articles.title: Chris Weidman on beating Anderson Silva to become UFC champion, BRUTAL leg injury | Daniel Cormier
articles.description: Former UFC champion and MMA legend Chris Weidman sits down with DC in the fourth episode of The Daniel Cormier Show! Cormier and Weidman talk about his two fights against Anderson Silva, and what it was like to both become champion and see such a gruesome leg injury. Chris also reveals his tough childhood with his brother, talking about how he would get physically and emotionally bullied to the point that him and his friends PUNCHED his broken collarbone! Weidman also breaks down his loss to Luke Rockhold and the brutal leg injury HE SUFFERED in the UFC 261 fight against Uriah Hall. Plus DC and Chris relive his road back to the octagon, his early wrestling days in high school and at Hofstra, and so much more! All lines provided by @hardrockbet Follow me on all social media platforms! articles.title: The Real Problem with Jon Jones vs Alex Pereira
articles.description: In this video, Chael Sonnen breaks down the real challenges behind a potential Jon Jones vs Alex Pereira matchup. While fans want the fight now, there are major factors keeping it from happening, including UFC scheduling, fighter priorities, and the complexities of title implications. Chael explains why Jon Jones is unique in his willingness to wait for fights, how UFC matchmaking works, and how Alex Pereira‚Äôs current injury affects timing. From ‚Äúone-and-done‚Äù concerns to planning meaningful fights with long-term significance, Chael gives the inside perspective on what‚Äôs really holding up one of the most anticipated matchups in MMA. articles.title: Islam Makhachev Opens Up About UFC 322 Weight Struggles
articles.description: In this video, Chael Sonnen breaks down Islam Makhachev‚Äôs weight struggles ahead of UFC 322. Islam reveals his challenge of walking around at 192 lbs, cutting down to 182 lbs on fight week, and adding back 12 lbs just before stepping into the Octagon. Chael explains why gaining weight as a professional fighter can be harder than it seems, especially when training with bigger partners and maintaining peak performance. We also dive into how Islam‚Äôs focus on both 155 lbs and 170 lbs creates a unique challenge for his career path, his mindset for fighting top contenders, and how his training adjustments could impact potential matchups‚Äîincluding his fight with Jack. If you‚Äôre a fan of UFC weight strategy, fighter insights, and Islam Makhachev‚Äôs road to success, this video gives an inside look at the physical and mental challenges elite fighters face. #IslamMakhachev #UFC322 #WeightCut #MMA #FightWeek #UFC #ChaelSonnen #MMAInsights #FighterMindset Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 All things UFC and MMA with the undefeated Bad Guy, Chael Sonnen. articles.title: UFC 321 overreactions, plus Topuria vs. Pimblett THE fight to make! | ORT
articles.description: "Overreaction Time" (Tuesdays, noon ET) is a weekly podcast hosted by MMA Junkie managing editor Simon Samano where he shares his "overreactions" with an MMA Junkie staff member, and the debate begins! On this edition, he and MMA Junkie senior reporter Mike Bohn discuss the following: (00:00) - Intro (01:12) - Ciryl Gane‚Äôs eye poke probably saved Tom Aspinall from defeat? (06:12) - Everyone blaming Tom Aspinall for ‚Äútaking the easy way out‚Äù can f*ck right off. (18:12) - Mackenzie Dern won‚Äôt make it through 2026 as UFC strawweight champion. (24:20) - Umar Nurmagomedov won‚Äôt be UFC bantamweight champion as long as Merab is around. (24:20) - Quillan Salkilld delivered the SCARIEST knockout of 2025. (27:55) - Ilia Topuria vs. Paddy Pimblett is the fight to make, and it should headline the UFC‚Äôs first numbered event on Paramount+. articles.title: Daniel Cormier REACTS to Tom Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane CONTROVERSIAL NO CONTEST, eye poke ends fight
articles.description: Daniel Cormier IS BACK live from Abu Dhabi UFC 321 to give his post-fight reaction to Tom Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane being ruled a NO CONTEST after an eye poke to Tom! DC weight in on the controversial end to the fight, and what that means for Gane and Aspinall moving forward. Plus, Cormier gives his take on Mackenzie Dern's title fight win in the co-main event. And DC issues an apology to Jailton Almedia following his comments this week to Aspinall. All lines provided by @hardrockbet Follow me on all social media platforms!
